citations.narrative:
After completing a guided tour, the tour guide returned to the gift shop and members of the public were allowed to
continue to feed and interact with animals in the petting zoo (this area is not in line of sight with the gift shop, and no other
employees were present in the petting zoo area). Members of the public must be supervised when touching or feeding
animals to ensure the safety of the people and the animals. Correct by ensuring that a responsible, knowledgeable and
readily identified employee must be present at all times during periods of public contact to ensure the safety of both the
animals and the general public.

One area of the facility is not enclosed by a perimeter fence. There is an outdoor enclosure housing 1 coati (located
behind the gift shop). Behind this coati enclosure there is no fence separating the facility from the property next door.
Perimeter fencing is important because it acts as a secondary containment system if an animal escapes from its primary
enclosure. Perimeter fencing also prevents the entry of unauthorized people and animals onto the property.
Correct by July 18, 2023 by installing a perimeter fence that is at least 6 feet tall and that encloses the outdoor enclosures
containing exotic mammals. Alternatively, a variance may be requested from the Deputy Administrator.
This inspection was conducted with an employee and the exit interview were conducted with the owner.
